newsitem.title: USA: Air Force officer resigns to avoid court martial.
newsitem.headline: Air Force officer resigns to avoid court martial.

text.p: The Air Force will allow an officer to resign and avoid a court-martial for fraternising with an enlisted woman who became his wife and lying about it, the Air Force announced Friday.

"Secretary of the Air Force Sheila E. Windnall today accepted Second Lt. William Kite's request to resign in lieu of trial by court-marital," the Air Force said in a statement. "Lt. Kite will receive a general discharge under honourable conditions."
Kite violated military law when he began a relationship with former Master Sgt. Rhonda Kutzer, now his wife, when the two served together at Whiteman Air Force Base in Missouri.
Compounding the offence, the couple then tried to hide their relationship from superiors.
The Kite case came on the heels of the Air Force's general discharge of Lt. Kelly Flinn, the first woman B-52 bomber pilot.
Flinn accepted a discharge rather than face a court-martial on charges of adultery with the husband of another Air Force woman, refusing to obey an order to end the relationship and lying about it.
